info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 5:02PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Tom Green County through 545 PM CDT... At 502 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Nasworthy, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Angelo, Twin Buttes Reservoir, Wall and Lake Nasworthy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
